text: Stepping into Bumbu Restaurant is like stepping back in time. This quaint eatery exudes the rich history of Singapore, from its charming decor to its traditional menu. The dishes are a delightful blend of old-world flavors and modern culinary techniques. The attentive service adds to the overall experience, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking a taste of authentic Singaporean cuisine.
Unusual food. Tried 9 dishes, every one good, but none delicious. Lovely atmosphere but a little noisy.
Had a fantastic family dinner at this beautifully decorated restaurant ... Service and food were great and the prices were extremely reasonable for the quality. Will def be back!

Bumbu Restaurant: A Peranakan Delight!

Rating:

• Food: 4/5 (Delicious Peranakan dishes, with highlights like the Buah Keluak Chicken and Seafood Fried Mee Sua)

• Atmosphere: 4.5/5 (Charming and inviting, evoking the charm of Malacca's historic Peranakan restaurants)

• Service: 4.5/5 (Friendly, helpful, and attentive staff)

• Value: 4/5 (Reasonable prices for the quality and variety of food offered)

Overall: 4.5/5

Donkey and I, along with our friends, recently enjoyed a fantastic lunch at Bumbu Restaurant, a popular Peranakan eatery near Beach Road.  The moment we stepped inside, we were transported to a Peranakan paradise! The space is clean, cozy, and comfortable, making it a truly inviting place to relax and enjoy a delicious meal.

Our friendly waiter recommended some of their most popular dishes, and we were blown away by the flavors!  Highlights included the rich and savory Buah Keluak Chicken, the comforting Fish Maw Soup, and the crispy Ngoh Hiang. The Seafood Fried Mee Sua and Tahu Telur were also standouts.  We ended our meal with a refreshing Honey Osmanthus dessert, the perfect sweet finish.

The service was excellent, with our waiter making sure we had a great dining experience. We highly recommend Bumbu Restaurant for an authentic and delicious Peranakan dining experience in Singapore!

Nice cosy space for a very intimate dining experience. The place is well decorated with posters and items from the 70/80s. The food is very reasonable for it's price point. The restaurant has a large menu, so we didn't manage to try everything. From what we had, the beef rendang is a top recommendation and a must try! The black squid was a surprise, and is something different from your regular squid dish. A must, open their prawn crackers! Fluffy, crunchy, and light, it was a delight to have. Food was served promptly, and we had a good experience.
